intro: Galega rosea, commonly known as the pink borage, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its hairy, upright stems and striking pink to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its leaves are ovate and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are arranged in clusters at the ends of the stems. Galega rosea is often used in ornamental gardening for its vibrant color and unique appearance.
